entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:32AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY THIS LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend with highs in the upper 70s into the 80s for the inner channels. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Starting Sunday and continuing through the first half of the week,

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 01 at 1:32AM PDT until July 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Trough of low pressure to bring gusty winds through the weekend... .A low pressure trough impacting the west Coast will bring gusty winds to portions of the state over the weekend. The winds and low humidity will allow for critical fire weather conditions to develop Saturday and Sunday for portions of central and eastern Nevada. Little to no rain is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Elko County; Northern Nye County - Mojave; White Pine and Northeast Nye Counties

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:37AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.
